subject: Software Quality Assurance and Testing - Lecture 5

questions.question: What does TestNG stand for?
Which framework inspired TestNG?
Which of the following is NOT a feature of TestNG? [cite: 2004-2006]
Which annotation runs before every test method?
Which annotation runs once before all tests in a specific suite?
What does the `@Test(enabled = false)` attribute do? [cite: 2043]
options: It runs the test multiple times
It marks the test as failed

questions.question: Which attribute is used to run a test method multiple times? [cite: 2043]
What is the purpose of the `priority` attribute in `@Test`? [cite: 2043]
options: To define the severity of the defect
To determine the order of execution (lower priorities run first)
To set the timeout for the test
questions.correct_answer: To determine the order of execution (lower priorities run first)

questions.question: Where are the default TestNG reports generated? [cite: 2049]
Which file contains an index-like structure of different parts of the report (failed tests, passed tests, etc.)? [cite: 2056]
Which built-in class in TestNG is used to log messages into the reports? [cite: 2062]
What is the correct syntax to log a message using the Reporter class?
How are parameters passed to a TestNG test method usually defined? [cite: 2087]
Which annotation is used to accept parameters in a test method? [cite: 2086]
What is the purpose of Assertions in TestNG? [cite: 2090]
options: To log messages to the console
To verify that the expected result matches the actual result
questions.correct_answer: To verify that the expected result matches the actual result

questions.question: What happens if an assertion fails in a TestNG test case? [cite: 2091]
options: The test continues to the next line
The test is marked as passed
The test is marked as failed overall
questions.correct_answer: The test is marked as failed overall

questions.question: Which of the following is an advantage of Parallel Testing? [cite: 2107]
options: It increases the overall execution time
It reduces the overall execution time
It removes the need for assertions
questions.correct_answer: It reduces the overall execution time

questions.question: What is a disadvantage of Parallel Testing? [cite: 2110]
options: It cannot be done with Selenium
It fails on dependent modules that rely on each other
It is slower than serial execution
questions.correct_answer: It fails on dependent modules that rely on each other

questions.question: In the `testng.xml` file, which attribute is used to define the number of threads for parallel execution?
What are Listeners in Selenium/TestNG? [cite: 2120]
options: Background processes that slow down tests
Interfaces that modify the default behavior of the system (logs, reports)
Methods to listen to audio files
questions.correct_answer: Interfaces that modify the default behavior of the system (logs, reports)

questions.question: Which TestNG listener method is called on the failure of any test? [cite: 2133]
What is the main difference between WebDriver Listener and TestNG Listener? [cite: 2137]
options: WebDriver Listener handles reporting; TestNG Listener handles events
WebDriver Listener captures browser events; TestNG Listener generates reports/logs for test status
TestNG Listener only works with JUnit
questions.correct_answer: WebDriver Listener captures browser events; TestNG Listener generates reports/logs for test status

questions.question: What is Log4j? [cite: 2140]
Which element is the root of a Log4j 2 configuration file? [cite: 2150]
What does the `Appenders` element do in Log4j configuration? [cite: 2151]
options: It configures where the logs are outputted (e.g., console, file)
questions.correct_answer: It configures where the logs are outputted (e.g., console, file)

questions.question: What is ExtentReports? [cite: 2158]
options: A closed-source tool for manual testing
An open-source reporting library that generates interactive HTML reports
A database for storing test results
questions.correct_answer: An open-source reporting library that generates interactive HTML reports

questions.question: Which file extension is used for the default TestNG emailable report? [cite: 2051]
Which annotation is used for data-driven testing in TestNG? [cite: 2020]
What is the `threadPoolSize` attribute used for in `@Test`? [cite: 2043]
options: To specify the size of the thread pool for the method when invocationCount is used
To count the number of threads in the CPU
To define the priority of threads
questions.correct_answer: To specify the size of the thread pool for the method when invocationCount is used

questions.question: Which listener method is called when a test is skipped? [cite: 2134]
What is `EventFiringWebDriver` used for? [cite: 2126]
options: To implement the WebDriver interface and catch WebDriver events
To start the browser in headless mode
questions.correct_answer: To implement the WebDriver interface and catch WebDriver events

questions.question: Which reporting class allows adding screenshots to the report? [cite: 2163]
What does `@BeforeGroups` do? [cite: 2036]
options: Runs after all groups are finished
Runs shortly before the first test method belonging to any of the specified groups
Runs before every method in the group
questions.correct_answer: Runs shortly before the first test method belonging to any of the specified groups

questions.question: Which annotation guarantees a method runs after all test methods in the current class? [cite: 2040]
What is the benefit of high-level logging using TestNG Reporter Log? [cite: 2080]
options: It logs every single step and variable
It logs only critical steps that the tester wants to see
questions.correct_answer: It logs only critical steps that the tester wants to see
